alert.note: Alert for Nueces (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 02 at 12:54PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south Texas, including the following county, Nueces. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1254 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Corpus Christi Bay and Oso Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Corpus Christi, La Palmera Mall, Driscoll Childrens Hospital, Bay Area Medical Center, Corpus Christi Country Club, Cole Park, Texas A&M University Corpus Christi, Spohn Hospital South, Del Mar College Heritage Campus, Downtown Corpus Christi, Cabaniss Field, Kings Crossing Subdivision, Del Mar College Windward Campus, South Texas Botanical Gardens, Corpus Christi North Beach, Flour Bluff, Waldron Field and Corpus Christi Naval Air Station. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
